intro: Armeria amoena, commonly known as the sea thrift, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Europe and North America. It is a low-growing evergreen perennial that produces dense clusters of white or pink flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is well adapted to salty, windy environments. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often used in coastal landscaping. Armeria amoena is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to stabilize dunes.
